metadata.title: CVE-2014-8173 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The pmd_none_or_trans_huge_or_clear_bad function ininclude/asm-generic/pgtable.h in the Linux kernel before 3.13 on NUMAsystems does not properly determine whether a Page Middle Directory (PMD)entry is a transparent huge-table entry, which allows local users to causea denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and system crash) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via a crafted MADV_WILLNEED madvise systemcall that leverages the absence of a page-table lock.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-1-generic - 3.13.0-1.16
linux-image-3.13.0-1-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-1.16
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-1-generic - 3.13.0-1.16
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-generic-lpae - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-lowlatency - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-e500mc - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-emb - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-3.16.0-25-powerpc64-smp - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
linux-image-extra-3.16.0-25-generic - 3.16.0-25.33~14.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-lowlatency - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-emb - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
No subscription required
